meanings.definition: To catch sight of or perceive
meanings.sent1: She espies a squirrel in the park.
meanings.sent2: He espies his friend across the street.
meanings.sent3: The detective espies a clue hidden in the room.
meanings.sent4: The eagle espies its prey from high above.
meanings.sent5: The explorer espies a hidden cave behind the waterfall.

meanings.sent1: The child espies a rainbow after the rain.
meanings.sent2: I espies a shooting star in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The cat espies a mouse scurrying along the wall.
meanings.sent4: She espies a rare flower blooming in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The hiker espies a beautiful view from the mountaintop.

meanings.sent1: The scientist espies a new species of insect in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The security guard espies a suspicious figure near the entrance.
meanings.sent3: The robot espies movement in the dark room.
meanings.sent4: The astronomer espies a comet through the telescope.
meanings.sent5: The photographer espies a perfect moment to capture on film.
